meanings.sent1: She tends to misrate the distance when throwing a ball.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to misrate the time it takes to complete a task.
meanings.sent3: Don't misrate the size of the cake; it's bigger than it looks!
meanings.sent4: His ability to misrate people's intentions often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The detective's habit of misrating suspects made him a unique investigator.

meanings.sent1: He would often misrate his own skills and talents.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to misrate the importance of small gestures.
meanings.sent3: She would misrate the value of old coins, thinking they were worthless.
meanings.sent4: The team's coach warned them not to misrate the strength of their opponents.
meanings.sent5: Misrating the impact of climate change can lead to disastrous consequences.
